ProposalInformation.Title: SIAF PRD & Alignment Matrix Update (NIRCam-FGS Alignment)
ProposalInformation.Abstract:
This proposal is to achieve 1 arcsec absolute pointing for NIRCam by:
1. Empirically determining field angle location, orientations, scale (and other low-order distortions) of NIRCam and FGSs 1&2 2. Updating the SOC PRD's "NIRCam_SIAF.xml" and "FGS_SIAF.xml" files to capture the above determinations. 3. Updating the STA-FGS Alignment Matrix using same process described in OTE-02 (COM/OTE 1135), OTE-05 (COM/OTE 1138), and OTE-08 (COM/OTE 1142) 4. Taking and assessing a confirmatory image to verify that operational pointing utilized the PRD updates and STA-FGS update, and the required pointing accuracy was achieved.
RATIONALE:
The PRIMARY DRIVER for this proposal is the pointing requirement on NIRCam before proceeding with OTE commissioning. We need to point NIRCam with sufficient accuracy (< 1 arcsec radial absolute) to support target placement at the PIL/DHS field points without utlizing target acquisition. To do so we need to execute an interim calibration of the NIRCam and FGS geometric distortions as well as an on-orbit determination of the FGS1-FGS2 and the FGS-NIRCam alignment within the ISIM focal plane. This will be accomplished by obtaining images of stars in the LMC astrometric field with these instruments.
A SECONDARY PURPOSE for this proposal is to enable an STA-FGS Alignment Matrix Update. Utilizing a subset of the data obtained here, we will take advantage of our first opportunity to calibrate an overall OTE field rotation (rV1) resulting from DTA uncertainties. STA-FGS Alignment Matrix Updates 1 through 3 will have already been performed, but with those observations limited to only a single star, only a field offset (rV2,rV3) was calibrated. Using the same process described in the Alignment Matrix Update PIFs, we will now supply multiple points as input to a new STA-FGS Alignment Matrix update, which will thus be able to reduce the overall rotation error between the FGS (OTE) and the STA/J-frame. As discussed in Alignment Matrix Update 1 (PIF-02), a 0.5deg orientation error in OTE FOV could be possible from worst-case rotation per axis from DTA deployment. This produces ~5" of position error over FGS to NIRCam distances. This error has been within pointing requirements during earlier OTE commissioning but should be addressed now, which is actually the first opportunity to do so, along with the NIRCam-FGS alignment, to reduce this contribution to pointing error going forward.
A SUPPLEMENTAL OBJECTIVE of this proposal is to potentially reveal any pronounced vignetting effect through relative aperture photometry of stars near the edge of the FOVs as measured among a small number of shifted pointings. The pointing offsets are required as part of the geometric calibration activities that form the primary purpose of this proposal, while allowing for a simple assessment of possible vignetting through a small amount of additional analysis. Success of this proposal does not depend on the results of the vigetting analysis.
ProposalInformation.ObservingDescription:
NIRCam and FGS imaging of the LMC astrometric field will be used to acquire the data needed to meet the objectives of this proposal, There are three main parts of this proposal; (1) calibrate the geometric distortion and scale of the NIRCam short and long channels, with a value added vignetting check, (2) calibrate the geometric distortion and scale of the two FGS channels, with a value added check of vignetting, and (3) to obtain an on-orbit measurement of the relative locations of the FGS channels with respect to NIRCam and with respect to one another.
These observations will also allow us to calibrate the rotation of the ISIM V1 axis with respect to the star tracker J-frame.
OBSERVATION 1 For the NIRCam geometric distortion calibration, the mid-point of the LMC catalog will be placed at the mid point between the NIRCam channels A & B. (MODULE=ALL) This assures that cataloged stars will be observed in both channels regardless of the orientation of the telescope (thus being robust against scheduling constraints). Two filters will be used so that the spectral types of the imaged stars can be estimated, thereby providing the means to check for color dependency in the NIRCam calibration, and as a means to obtain a rough estimate of the FGS color dependent throughput, when compared with the photometry obtained during the FGS imaging. FGS1 images are taken in parallel and will be used to complement observations 4 and 5.
OBSERVATIONS 2, 3 For the FGS geometric calibration images, the mid-point of the catalog will be placed at the center of the FGS channel being calibrated (the other channel will be executing the guide function on a single guide star, which need not be an entry in the LMC catalog). This will assure that: (1) the same stars are used to calibrate FGS1 and FGS2, (2) we will thus obtain an accurate measure of the relative sensitivity of guiders 1 & 2 (3) there will be a significant overlap of targets observed in the NIRCam visit. Again, these observations are executed with NIRCam as prime and one FGS imaging in parallel to provide supplementary data for the FGS1-FGS2 and the FGS-NIRCam alignment.
The two observations produce the initial pointing described with a 50 arcsecond offset along the X axis for the same reasons described for NIRCam Observation 1 above. This is performed for both FGS channels with inverted imaging/guiding roles.
OBSERVATIONS 4, 5 These are two simple pointings of NIRCam+FGS1 and NIRCam+FGS2 imaging, respectively, with two integratiosn each and without dithers. These will be used to establish the relative alignment and orientation of FGS1, FGS2, and NIRCam. For the NIRCam-to-FGS alignment observations, the mid-point of the LMC catalog will be placed at a designated location between the NIRCam and FGS channels so that regardless of the telescope orient at the actual time of the observations there will be an adequate number of LMC catalog stars (either from the HST and/or the VLT/HAWK-I catalog) in each of the apertures to accurately determine their relative locations within the ISIM focal place.
OBSERVATIONS 6, 7 RealTime Special Requirements were added as part of the confirmation observations (6, 7) in order to capture as per our convention the spacecraft memory load uplink that must occur prior. This will be to update the STA-FGS alignment matrix k-constants via the Loads PRD. Rapid CM/CM/CRB approval required.
Also prior to these confirmation observations, the SIAF file for NIRCam, FGS1, and FGS2 must be updated based on analysis from the previous observations in the proposal. A new S&OC PRD will be delivered, and the PPS/OPGS systems must ingest the new SIAF PRD information. These updated must be incorporated when generating the visits for Observations 6 and 7.
****NOTE that Rapid CM/CM/CRB approval process for the SIAF delivery is required. This will be the first time we will be updating the SIAF, and as a necessary step in commissioning, this must be performed as expeditiously as possible.****

Target.Comments: Target to be placed at DHS location in NIRCamA to evaluate accuracy of the FGS-NIRCam alignment update.
The approximate center of the HST LMC calibration field catalog is identified by this Gaia DR1 source.

Observation.Label: NIRCam_distortion_calibration
Observation.Comments: For this observation (NIRCam geometric distortion calibration), the mid-point of the LMC catalog will be placed at the mid point between the NIRCam channels A & B. (MODULE=ALL) This assures that cataloged stars will be observed in both channels regardless of the orientation of the telescope (thus being robust against scheduling constraints). Two filters will be used so that the spectral types of the imaged stars can be estimated, thereby providing the means to check for color dependency in the NIRCam calibration, and as a means to obtain a rough estimate of the FGS color dependent throughput, when compared with the photometry obtained during the FGS imaging.

Observation.Label: FGS1_distortion_calibration
Observation.Comments: For this observation, the mid-point of the catalog will be placed at the center of the FGS1 channel (FGS2 will be executing the guide function on a single guide star, which need not be an entry in the LMC catalog).

Observation.Label: FGS2_distortion_calibration
Observation.Comments: For this observation, the mid-point of the catalog will be placed at the center of the FGS2 channel (FGS1 will be executing the guide function on a single guide star, which need not be an entry in the LMC catalog).

Observation.Label: NIRCam_FGS1_alignment
Observation.Comments: In observation 4 and 5 FGS2 will execute the guide function. FGS1 will obtain images of the LMC field in parallel with NIRCam images, followed by a repeat of the FGS1 images, while FGS2 remains in fine guide. No dithers, or any offsets of the telescope are to be executed. The two FGS1 images will be compared to measure any telescope motion that may have occured during the observing sequence.

Observation.Label: Confirmation_NIRCam_NRCA3_DHSPIL
Observation.Comments:
RealTime Special Requirement is present in order to perform the spacecraft memory load uplink that must occur prior to this NIRCam observation. FOS/FOT activity: 1. Deliver appropriate spacecraft memory load containing the STA-FGS alignment matrix k-constants to the Loads PRD. Rapid CM/CM/CRB approval required. 2. Create Ops Request for the realtime upload. 3. Once the Ops Request is received by the FOS, retrieve the Spacecraft memory load from the Loads PRD and prepare for uplink. 4. Execute ops request to upload the k-constants. 5. OP must then be invoked to proceed with this and subsequent observations.
This Observation must not execute until: - The above Real Time activity to upload the STA-FGS alignment matrix based on analysis from previous observations is completed AND - The SIAF file for NIRCam, FGS1, and FGS2 is updated based on analysis from previous observations. A new SOC PRD is delivered, and the PPS/OPGS ingests the new SIAF PRD information. This must included reprocessing this proposal so that this and the following observation will execute refecting the updated calibrations.
NOTE that Rapid CM/CM/CRB approval process for the SIAF delivery is required. This will be the first time we will be updating the SIAF, and as a necessary step in commissioning, this must be performed as expeditiously as possible.

Observation.Label: Confirmation_NIRCam_NRCB4_DHSPIL
Observation.Comments:
RealTime Special Requirement is present in order to perform the spacecraft memory load uplink that must occur prior to this NIRCam observation. FOS/FOT activity: 1. Deliver appropriate spacecraft memory load containing the STA-FGS alignment matrix k-constants to the Loads PRD. Rapid CM/CM/CRB approval required. 2. Create Ops Request for the realtime upload. 3. Once the Ops Request is received by the FOS, retrieve the Spacecraft memory load from the Loads PRD and prepare for uplink. 4. Execute ops request to upload the k-constants. 5. OP must then be invoked to proceed with this and subsequent observations.
This Observation is must not execute until: - The above Real Time activity to upload the STA-FGS alignment matrix based on analysis from previous observations is completed AND - The SIAF file for NIRCam, FGS1, and FGS2 is updated based on analysis from previous observations. A new SOC PRD is delivered, and the PPS/OPGS ingests the new SIAF PRD information. This must included reprocessing this proposal so that the confirmation observations will execute refecting the updated calibrations.
NOTE that Rapid CM/CM/CRB approval process for the SIAF delivery is required. This will be the first time we will be updating the SIAF, and as a necessary step in commissioning, this must be performed as expeditiously as possible.
